185664150.review:
First off, I have a lot of nostalgia for this game, having played it many times when it first came out over 15 years ago. It's a good story with fun missions. 

With that being said, this game has not aged particularly well in it's current form. So be prepared for that, especially if you've played games like Jedi: Fallen Order & Jedi: Survivor. I hope one day this game will get a full remake with additional missions as the campaign feels a lot shorter than I remember.

184861325.review:
*No Spoilers*
I love this game! I played this game on the PS3 for many years and the PC version did not disappoint. I can confirm that this version supports controllers if you use them like I do. While the campaign can be completed quickly, it's extremely fun and well done. I personally have played the campaign and random levels multiple times while still having a good time. This version also comes with extra DLC levels and costumes for even more fun. The different enemies, bosses, lightsabers, costumes, and abilities offer a very enjoyable gaming experience. I absolutely recommend this incredible game.

But this time, playing it right after Fallen Order and Jedi Survivor, I realize what an utter turd of a game it is.

Looks pretty, but the controls are awkward and sluggish, just a pain to try to play it.

The sequel was much better.

184804339.review: I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for his birthday from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the day he had 13 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories. Happy memories until it was not. He got to invested and thought he was an actual sith slayer. He challenged anyone he saw. He had to find out the hard way that there was no re-spawn button when he walked down that alley way in London. Now hes a jedi ghost who haunts me.

184717855.review: Buen juego para su epoca, capaz que ahora se queda corto con los nuevos lanzamientos que tubo star wars con sus nuevos juegos, pero este juego valdria la pena hacerle una tercera parte la verdad. un juego muy nostalgico y maravilloso.

184580578.review:
Évaluation : 🌟🌟🌟🌟 (4/5)
"Star Wars: The Force Unleashed – La puissance de la Force à portée de main."

Star Wars: The Force Unleashed, développé par LucasArts, offre une expérience spectaculaire où vous incarnez Starkiller, l’apprenti secret de Dark Vador. Avec son gameplay centré sur l’utilisation de la Force et une histoire captivante qui explore les zones grises de l’univers Star Wars, le jeu est un véritable régal pour les fans.

Les Points Forts :
✅ Une histoire inédite et immersive :
Le scénario, qui se situe entre l'Épisode III et l'Épisode IV, explore les thèmes de rédemption, de trahison et de lutte intérieure. Starkiller est un personnage complexe, et son voyage ajoute une nouvelle dimension à la saga.

✅ Un gameplay axé sur la Force :
L’utilisation de pouvoirs surpuissants comme la poussée, l’éclair ou la manipulation d’objets est incroyablement satisfaisante. Chaque combat vous fait sentir la puissance d’un utilisateur de la Force.

✅ Des environnements variés et riches :
Vous parcourez des lieux emblématiques et nouveaux de l’univers Star Wars, comme Felucia, Kashyyyk ou encore l'Étoile Noire. Chaque environnement est unique et regorge de détails.

✅ Un combat dynamique :
Mélangez sabre laser et pouvoirs de la Force pour des combos spectaculaires. Les affrontements contre des ennemis variés, dont des AT-ST et des Rancors, sont épiques et mettent vos réflexes à l’épreuve.

✅ Un style cinématique réussi :
Les séquences cinématiques et les animations, bien que datées, restent impressionnantes grâce à la mise en scène et aux performances des acteurs.

✅ Une histoire bien intégrée dans le canon :
Pour les fans de lore, le jeu développe des arcs intéressants qui enrichissent l'univers Star Wars tout en proposant des surprises mémorables.

Les Points Faibles :
⚠️ Un level design linéaire :
Bien que les environnements soient détaillés, leur exploration est souvent limitée. Le jeu suit une structure linéaire, ce qui peut frustrer ceux qui recherchent plus de liberté.

⚠️ Des contrôles parfois rigides :
Certaines mécaniques, comme le ciblage des objets avec la Force, peuvent être imprécises, rendant certains puzzles et combats frustrants.

⚠️ Un manque de variété dans les ennemis :
Les affrontements, bien que satisfaisants, deviennent répétitifs avec le temps. Vous affrontez souvent les mêmes types d’ennemis dans des situations similaires.

⚠️ Graphismes un peu vieillissants :
Bien que l’esthétique générale reste impressionnante, certaines textures et animations montrent l’âge du jeu.

En conclusion :
Star Wars: The Force Unleashed est un hommage explosif à l’univers Star Wars, offrant une histoire captivante et un gameplay qui vous fait vraiment sentir comme un maître de la Force. Bien qu’il ait ses limites techniques et de conception, il reste un incontournable pour les fans de la saga et ceux qui recherchent une aventure remplie d’action.

🎮 Verdict final :
Un mélange de puissance brute et de narration émotive qui transporte le joueur dans une galaxie lointaine, très lointaine. Malgré ses défauts, l’expérience vaut le détour.

⏳ Temps de jeu recommandé :

Campagne principale : 8 à 10 heures.
Exploration et défis : 12+ heures pour découvrir tous les secrets et holocrons.
✨ Note personnelle : Starkiller nous rappelle que le côté obscur n’a jamais été aussi tentant... et spectaculaire.

184536768.review:
It's uncommon for me to drop games because of some of the mechanics or fights, but this is one of those times. All bossfights feel bland, pretty much all combat is the same and only terrain is your actual enemy (and fking being staggered and turned into a ragdoll), but the star destroyer "fight" was where I had enough, it's not even hard, simply boring and slow (some say it works better with some fix that remove the fps locks, but I don't even want to check that out), not to mention how unclear it is on mouse + keyboard, where it looks like you should put your mouse on a treadmill but in fact it works better when you make slow movements. I could probably write a book about how bad that whole mission was, yet all I'll add is, who tf thought it would be funny to add another one of the droid fights right before the fight with SD? "my computer analysis says it's the best time for a surprise attack", I was surprised that the enemy was trash and for once couldn't block every of my attacks and I could just spam everything on him with no effort...

I starts of strong, tho very cliche, story is predictable since the beginning, further relying on cliche motives or straight up things from the movies, but it isn't too bad either, maybe some faces that Starkiller makes could be better as he looks bit too goofy at times. It's a tpp slasher so in the end it doesn't matter that much, all of the excuses to kill are just as good in the context of the game anyway.

Combat beside it being "throw/topple enemy or be staggered if there are more than 2 or at least one big enemy" was fun at times, while at others it was a chore and not a fun one. I'd rather clean everyones toilet with my tongue than fight on small platforms or try to jump over endless pit when enemies have undodgeable attacks with hitboxes wither size of a barn or of an apple (maybe two), "good" thing is that it works both ways and some dash slashes or saber combos after turning to other enemy were hitting from 5m, but that's still a bad design even if fair. All that could be called a skill issue or maybe just a matter of not being used to ported games or even refusing to play on a controller (for a sec I though of borrowing one from a friend and then playing through castlevanias), but the fact that some enemies can turn you into a ragdoll, start another attack that will stagger you or once again turn you into a ragdoll and do that few times as the time it takes you to get up is sometimes just stupidly long (especialy when you slide down a tiniest ramp or bump). I don't mind waiting out attacks, looking for openings or using powers and environment, I do mind being unable to block, dodge or get out of a situation where I made the mistake, as it stimply does feel like a qte sequence, where this time finally you are punished for making a mistake (I don't think I made one that reduced my life, at least during boss battles, but it seems like qte magic gives you full invu just like every other cutscene (tho enemy AI is turned on and they do take actions all the time throughout them)).

I'd say if you skip everything and just focus on the gameplay or finding the cholocrons it could be better, but you can't skip cutscenes, movies between the mission or anything else, so just watch a 100% speedrun to dinner or read the story recap on wiki.

184527490.review:
I wanna start off by saying I remember playing both the PS2 & PS3 versions as a kid Loving them both (PS2 version is better imo) 

However I must say this Game has aged HORRENDOUSLY!

Straight off the bat it's locked to 30fps so unless you download a community mod to uncap the fps then you're stuck with a 15+ yr old Game running at 30fp. However it's important to add that even if you do use the mod the physics are buggy af without the cap. 

(ALSO HALFWAY THROUGH THE CAMPAIGN THE AUDIO WILL BUG OUT MANUALLY REQUIRING YO TO DOWNLOAD LOST AUDIO FILES, SO FUN)

Secondly the combat and missions are so mundane with spam lock enemies to saber duel that should be fun, but the combat just doesn't work 1v1. I.E The Darth Maul duel you have with proxy is so rigged with spam lock attacks that left me having to use force grip for the entire fight which sucked all the fun out of a fun call back.

Lastly are the overuse of QTE. RE4 couldn't do it and Aspyr sure as hell didn't. After whittling down an enemies health bar you're then treated to a clunky mini game where you'll have to stare at rather than the actual entertaining action onscreen. I don't even wanna talk about that stupid Star Destroyer QTE...

So is the Game bad? Maybe it's nostalgia, but I do actually enjoy the Games story, characters & customisation, plus the use of the Euphoria physics engine (throwing a Stormtrooper, Rodian or a poor defenceless Jawa into the abyss as they scream never gets old) 

I'm just saying if you haven't played the Game in awhile you might be sorely disappointed seeing how poorly it's aged in certain aspects and a terrible Port!

Will add that the DLC and final mission are super fun!

184497599.review: The Force Unleashed was an amazing game and I absolutely loved the story. I haven't really played it on steam because the port sucks for windows 11 but I have countless hours on the Nintendo Wii and Xbox 360. This was the game that got me into video games when I was 10 so this game has a special place in my heart. The game mechanics in this game was absolutely astounding for 2008. Even 14 years later I look back fondly at the amazing abilities and combos this game had. The only downside I see to this game besides the bad windows 11 port is that there were some missed opportunities. I really wished they added the missions where you go to Cloud city or the Jedi Temple like they did for the Wii and PlayStation 2 version. Overall I give this game a 10/10

184424337.review:
[h1]QUE A FORÇA ESTEJA CONTIGO[/h1]
Em Star Wars: The Force Unleashed, controlamos Starkiller, um padawan de Darth Vader, que foi treinado em segredo do Imperador Palpatine, com a missão de destruir os inimigos do Império. Starkiller, em suas missões, se mostrou muito bem capaz, mas algo acontece que faz com que ele se questione se realmente está fazendo a coisa certa.

Star Wars The Force Unleashed é um legend, O que significa que não é canônico? Starkiller é mais poderoso que Darth Vader e Palpatine. Vemos isso durante o jogo, quando ele é capaz de literalmente parar um Destroyer. O jogo conta com gráficos realmente bons, sendo um jogo de 2008. Temos alguns poderes Jedi que se misturam com os do lado Sith. As músicas são muito boas, me relembrando a nostalgia de assistir Star Wars. A jogabilidade pode ser realmente difícil, e eu realmente precisei aprender a controlar o personagem e fazer cada movimento. A ambientação é muito boa, mas o que eu não gostei muito foi a história, que é muito curta, e os personagens pouco desenvolvidos, sem muita importância. Mas, mesmo assim, vale a pena jogar Star Wars: The Force Unleashed. Então, você está pronto para se juntar à Força em [h1]Star Wars The Force Unleashed[/h1]
